content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────
### Copper Cable Factory Interface at Position(x=2.5, y=17.5)
Consists of the input module for copper cable production:
• Cable Factory Input Chest at Position(x=2.5, y=17.5)
• Dedicated Burner Inserter placed at Position(x=3.5, y=17.5) using direction RIGHT; it is linked with a secondary burner inserter (retrieved at Position(x=2.5, y=16.5)) and an Assembling Machine at Position(x=1.5, y=19.5) that together channel raw materials into copper cable assembly.

### Belt Depot System at Position(x=3.5, y=15.5)
Serves as an intermediary target for belt connections between the extraction source and production:
• Wooden Chest placed at Position(x=3.5, y=15.5) acting as the isolated belt depot.
• Transport Belt Segment installed at Position(x=4.5, y=15.5) adjacent to the chest.
• Dedicated Depot Burner Inserter placed at Position(x=3.5, y=14.5) using direction UP, with its pickup aligned to the chest at (3.5, y=15.5) and drop position at (3.5, y=13.5).

ERROR TIPS
────────────
• Belt Connection Issues – Multiple attempts to connect transport belts have failed because the target was a Prototype.SteamEngine. To avoid this, always route the belt connection through an intermediary inserter that can input items into the steam engine rather than connecting directly to it.
• Wooden Chest Placement Failures – Placement errors occurred when the chest was targeted too far from the player and when the chest was missing from inventory. Ensure you are within the maximum allowed placement distance and verify that the required wooden chest is available before attempting placement.
• Undefined Target Variable – A NameError was triggered due to referencing “target_chest” instead of one of the defined target identifiers. Double-check variable names and use the correct reference (such as target_pos, target_place_pos, or depot_chest) to avoid such errors.
